images.title: Gordon Hatton / Burton Beck
images.caption: Burton Beck. Seen here as it flows through the grounds of Constable Burton Hall on a very frosty day. Burton Beck changes its name several times along its course, becoming Leeming Beck, Newton Beck, Crakehall Beck and Bedale Beck before eventually joining the Swale.

images.title: Gordon Hatton / The Old School, Constable Burton
images.caption: The Old School, Constable Burton. Once the village school, but now converted into a house. Any children in this small village would now have to be transported to Hunton or Spennithorne.

description: This pretty village is located near Leyburn in the Richmondshire district of North Yorkshire. The settlement includes Constable Burton Hall, a grade-I-listed Georgian mansion dating back to 1768. This walk takes you around the lovely grounds which include beautiful gardens and views of the Burton Beck and surrounding Yorkshire Dales countryside. The hall gardens are open on certain days with more information on the link below. To continue your walking around the village head just a couple of miles south east to visit Thornton Steward Reservoir. There's some pleasant trails to follow around the small lake and a visit to Arklow Hill.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Wyvill Arms, is set in a former 18th-century farmhouse. The pub serves high quality food and has been featured in the Good Pub Guide. You can find them at postcode DL8 5LH.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the south you'll find a major historic local highlight at Jervaulx Abbey. The 12th century ruined abbey is surrounded by 126 acres of attractive parkland with wildflowers, grazing sheep, a pretty pond and fine views of the surrounding North Yorkshire countryside.
